dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: President Trump just called a caravan of his own supporters in Seattle a "violent protest" after they were seen with the National Guard.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: President Trump just called a caravan of his own supporters in Seattle a violent protest after they were seen with the National Guard.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But given the opportunity to denounce a caravan of his supporters in Portland, who were caught on video Saturday shooting protesters with paintballs or tear gas, Trump called it a peaceful protest and declared paint is not bullets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he also, uh, commented on Kyle Rittenhouse, that 20-year-old from Kenosha, calling it a "sad situation" but suggesting he was trying to help protesters.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he also, uh, commented on Kyle Rittenhouse, that twenty-year-old from Kenosha, calling it a sad situation but suggesting he was trying to help protesters.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Asked about Rittenhouse, Trump called it an interesting situation, and claimed Rittenhouse was trying to get away from protesters who violently attacked him, asserting, without evidence, that Rittenhouse probably would've been killed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting because earlier, in his speech, Biden actually denounced violence on both the left and right, even mentioning groups like the Proud Boys.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting because earlier, in his speech, Biden actually denounced violence on both the left and right, even mentioning groups like the Proud Boys.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bidens remarks were met with immediate dissatisfaction from the Trump team, with Trump campaign advisor Jason Miller hitting Biden for not specifically mentioning radical left-wing groups like Antifa in his blanket denunciation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and Trump's team actually praised him for that—Jason Miller said it was good he specifically called out radical right-wing groups.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and Trump's team actually praised him for that-Jason Miller said it was good he specifically called out radical right-wing groups.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bidens remarks were met with immediate dissatisfaction from the Trump team, with Trump campaign advisor Jason Miller hitting Biden for not specifically mentioning radical left-wing groups like Antifa in his blanket denunciation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But then Trump went and claimed Biden would give Antifa their "far-left policy agenda," which is, like, a complete contrast to what was actually said.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then Trump went and claimed Biden would give Antifa their far-left policy agenda, which is, like, a complete contrast to what was actually said.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He mentioned law enforcement, but he didnt mention Antifa, I wonder why, Trump added, claiming Biden would give the decentralized anarchist group the far-left policy agenda its asking for.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Biden's response was pretty direct—he asked, "Do I look like a moderate socialist with a soft spot for protesters?"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Biden's response was pretty direct-he asked, Do I look like a moderate socialist with a soft spot for protesters?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ask yourself: Do I look to you like a radical socialist with a soft spot for rioters? Really?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, Trump is planning to Portland on Tuesday to survey protest damage, even though the governor asked him not to.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, Trump is planning to Portland on Tuesday to survey protest damage, even though the governor asked him not to.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump is slated to travel to Kenosha on Tuesday to survey the damage from the protests, despite Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers urging him not to.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: He said it "could decrease enthusiasm" or "decrease hate," but honestly, it feels like it might just escalate things further.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He said it could decrease enthusiasm or decrease hate, but honestly, it feels like it might just escalate things further.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Should be very interesting, Trump said of the visit, predicting It could increase enthusiasm, it could increase love and respect for our country, after he was asked about concerns it could increase violence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And he admitted Kenosha was something they did a "bad job on," citing the lack of National Guard there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he admitted Kenosha was something they did a bad job on, citing the lack of National Guard there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kenosha is something we did a good job on, Trump said, citing the national guard intervention.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's just such a mixed message—praising peace one moment, then defending or criticizing his own supporters the next.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just such a mixed message-praising peace one moment, then defending or criticizing his own supporters the next.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And Biden's urging him to join in condemning violence no matter who does it, saying if he can't, he's not fit to be president.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And Biden's urging him to join in condemning violence no matter who does it, saying if he can't, he's not fit to be president.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the statement, Biden urged Trump to join me in saying that while peaceful protest is a right a necessity violence is wrong, period. No matter who does it, no matter what political affiliation they have. Period, and said that, if he cant, he is unfit to be President.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which, you know, puts the ball in Trump's court, but so far his responses have been all over the place.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, you know, puts the ball in Trump's court, but so far his responses have been all over the place.

artist_script:
HostA: President Trump just called a caravan of his own supporters in Seattle a "violent protest" after they were seen with the National Guard.
HostB: Yeah, and he also, uh, commented on Kyle Rittenhouse, that 20-year-old from Kenosha, calling it a "sad situation" but suggesting he was trying to help protesters.
HostA: It’s interesting because earlier, in his speech, Biden actually denounced violence on both the left and right, even mentioning groups like the Proud Boys.
HostB: Right, and Trump’s team actually praised him for that—Jason Miller said it was good he specifically called out radical right-wing groups.
HostA: But then Trump went and claimed Biden would give Antifa their "far-left policy agenda," which is, like, a complete contrast to what was actually said.
HostB: And Biden’s response was pretty direct—he asked, "Do I look like a moderate socialist with a soft spot for protesters?"
HostA: Meanwhile, Trump is planning to Portland on Tuesday to survey protest damage, even though the governor asked him not to.
HostB: He said it "could decrease enthusiasm" or "decrease hate," but honestly, it feels like it might just escalate things further.
HostA: And he admitted Kenosha was something they did a "bad job on," citing the lack of National Guard there.
HostB: It’s just such a mixed message—praising peace one moment, then defending or criticizing his own supporters the next.
HostA: Exactly. And Biden’s urging him to join in condemning violence no matter who does it, saying if he can’t, he’s not fit to be president.
HostB: Which, you know, puts the ball in Trump’s court, but so far his responses have been all over the place.
